intro: Navarretia stenosiphon, commonly known as the narrow-leaf navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, succulent leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. It is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, showcasing adaptations to conserve water. Navarretia stenosiphon is often found in coastal regions, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
